Incident.Summary: Second Degree Domestic Assault/ Possession CDS not Marijuana

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: My body worn camera was activated during this incident. Attachments: Maryland State Police Domestic Violence Supplemental Report and Lethality Screening Copy of Statement of Charges and Probable Cause Copy of Chain of Custody and Evidence Photographs uploaded to Veripic Victim: Jonathan Andrew Hurley (DOB: 4/2/1980, W/F) 6309 Old Washington Rd Sykesville, MD 21784 443-789-7917 Victim Statement: Hurley was interviewed in the parking lot of the Boston Inn, located at 533 Baltimore Blvd, Westminster, MD 21157, outside of room 160. Hurley advised that he got into an argument with his wife, Amy Lynn Logsdon (DOB: 6/21/1981, W/F) about moving out of the room they had been staying in at the Boston Inn, as well as their dogs getting out. Hurley informed that during the argument Logsdon grabbed and scratched the back of his neck. Hurley further stated that Logsdon ran off, towards the shopping center on Jermor Ln, after grabbing and scratching his neck. Hurley stated that he did not physically assault Logsdon but informed that they have a history of domestic violence. Hurley advised that he did not want medical treatment for the injury he sustained. Scene Processing: I viewed the back of Hurleys neck, where he stated Logsdon grabbed and scratched him. I observed the back of his neck to be bright red with marks consistent with being scratched. Once Logsdon was located, I also viewed her hands and observed her fingers, on both hands, to be red and almost bruised. I photographed the back of Hurleys neck to document the visible physical injury he sustained. I also photographed Logsdons hands to document the redness and almost bruising on her fingers. I uploaded the photographs to Veripic. Suspect: Amy Lynn Logsdon (DOB: 6/21/1981, W/F) 6309 Old Washington Rd Sykesville, MD 21784 443-547-2498 Suspect Statement: Logsdon was interviewed in the parking lot outside of 521 Jermor Ln, Westminster, MD 21157. Logsdon advised that her and Hurley got into an argument about moving out of their room at the Boston Inn and Hurley letting the dogs get outside. Logsdon informed that she did not assault Hurley and he did not assault her during this incident. Narrative: On 4/16/2023 at approximately 1156 hours, I was dispatched to the Boston Inn, room 160, located at 533 Baltimore Blvd, Westminster, MD 21157 for the report of a domestic assault. Upon my arrival, I met with Jonathan Andrew Hurley (DOB: 4/2/1980, W/F) in the parking lot outside of room 160. I obtained the above statement from Hurley. I next conducted the above scene processing to observe and document the visible physical injury sustained to the back of his neck, which was consistent with being scratched. I also completed the Maryland State Police Domestic Violence Supplemental Report and Lethality Screening with Hurley. Hurley screened in as a high danger based on the score, he declined to speak with Counselor Abby, who I called based on his score. I referred Hurley to the commissioners office for a protective order. I next responded to the parking lot of the Jermor Ln shopping center and located Amy Lynn Logsdon (DOB: 6/21/1981, W/F), standing in the parking lot of 521 Jermor Ln, Westminster, MD 21157. I obtained the above initial statement from Logsdon. I also completed the above scene processing in reference to observing her hands to be red and almost bruised. Once I placed Logsdon under arrest for second degree domestic assault, she alleged that Hurley assaulted her on Saturday, over a week ago, with an open hand slap to the ear. Logsdon stated that she did not report the incident to police. I advised Logsdon of her right to complete charges against Hurley at the commissioners office, as well as get a protective order against him. I transported Logsdon to Carroll County Detention Center. Once at the Carroll County Detention Center I had a female Correctional Deputy, Deputy Meadows, perform a search of Logsdon incident to arrest. During the search, Deputy Meadows located two (2) plastic baggies containing a white crystal powder, suspected crystal methamphetamine, inside of her bra. I recognized crystal methamphetamine to be a Schedule II Controlled Dangerous Substance based on my training, knowledge, and experience as a Maryland State Trooper. Logsdon advised that she is unsure of what kind of drug was in in the plastic baggie but stated that its probably meth. Seized Property: Two (2) plastic baggies containing a white crystal powder, suspected crystal methamphetamine, weighing 0.4 grams. I recognize crystal methamphetamine to be a Schedule II Controlled Dangerous Substance based on my training, knowledge, and experience as a Maryland State Trooper. I photographed the previously mentioned seized CDS and uploaded them to Veripic. The above seized property was submitted in evidence per Maryland State Police policy. The proper paperwork was completed, and Logsdon was released into the custody of the Carroll County Detention Center. All events occurred in Carroll County, MD.

IncidentProperty.Description: Two plastic baggies containing a white crystal powder, suspected crystal methamphetamine
